Choosing the right channels to spread my malware is crucial.  It's like picking the perfect fishing spot - gotta go where the fish are biting.  

I look for places with lots of potential victims, places where people are careless and click on anything.  

Email attachments are always a classic. People get tricked by fake invoices, shipping notifications, even messages from "friends" with malicious links.

Then there's social media. People share everything online, so it's easy to hide malware in a post or message.  

And don't forget about those shady websites. People download cracked software, pirated movies, all sorts of stuff from sites they shouldn't trust. I can slip my malware right into those downloads. 

The key is to be subtle, to blend in.  I don't want to raise any red flags. I want my malware to spread like a virus, silently and quickly.
